detaileddescription.para: HTTP Success status
Unknown error
an Invalid handle or possible bad pointer was passed to a function
Buffer too small or a failure while in memory allocation
an attempt to use an invalid socket handle was made
Can't send socket parameters
Error while resolving host name
Error while connecting to the remote server
socket time out error
Error while receiving data
Error while sending data
Error while receiving the remote HTTP headers
Could not find element within header
The headers search clue was too large for the internal API buffer
No content length was specified for the outgoing data. the caller should specify chunking mode in the session creation
The HTTP chunk token that was received from the server was too big and possibly wrong
Could not authenticate with the remote host
Could not authenticate with the remote proxy
Bad or not supported HTTP verb was passed to a function
a function received a parameter that was too large
The session state prevents the current function from proceeding
Could not parse the chunk length while in chunked transfer
Could not parse curtail elements from the URL (such as the host name, HTTP prefix act')
Could not detect key elements in the received headers
Error while attempting to resize a buffer
Authentication schema is not supported
The selected authentication schema does not match the server response
an element was missing while parsing the digest authentication challenge
Digest algorithem could be MD5 or MD5-sess other types are not supported
Binding error
Tls negotiation error
Feature is not (yet) implemented
HTTP end of stream message
HTTP Supported authentication methods
HTTP supported verbs
http seesion handle
http seesion flags
HTTP Supported authentication methods
HTTP supported verbs
Data structure that the caller can request at any time that will include some information regarding the session
HTTP parameters

briefdescription.para: Allocate memory for a new HTTP Session.

parameterdescription.para: HTTP Session internal API flags, 0 should be passed here

briefdescription.para: Closes the active connection and free the corresponding memory.
Sets credentials for the target host.

memberdef.argsstring: (HTTP_SESSION_HANDLE pSession, CHAR *pProxyName, UINT16 nPort, CHAR *pUserName, CHAR *pPassword)
memberdef.name: HTTPClientSetProxy

briefdescription.para: Sets all the proxy related parameters.

parameterdescription.para: User name for proxy authentication (can be null)
User password for proxy authentication (can be null)

briefdescription.para: Sets the HTTP verb for the outgoing request.
Add headers into the outgoing request.

memberdef.argsstring: (HTTP_SESSION_HANDLE pSession, CHAR *pUrl, VOID *pData, UINT32 nDataLength, BOOL TotalLength, UINT32 nTimeout, UINT32 nClientPort)
memberdef.name: HTTPClientSendRequest

briefdescription.para: This function builds the request headers, performs a DNS resolution, opens the connection (if it was not opened yet by a previous request or if it has closed) and sends the request headers.

parameterdescription.para: Data to post to the server
Valid only when http method is post TRUE: Post data to http server. FALSE: In a post request without knowing the total length in advance so return error or use chunking.

memberdef.argsstring: (HTTP_SESSION_HANDLE pSession, VOID *pBuffer, UINT32 nBufferLength, UINT32 nTimeout)
memberdef.name: HTTPClientWriteData

briefdescription.para: Write data to the remote server.

parameterdescription.para: Data to write to the server

briefdescription.para: Receives the response header on the connection and parses it. Performs any required authentication.

memberdef.argsstring: (HTTP_SESSION_HANDLE pSession, VOID *pBuffer, UINT32 nBytesToRead, UINT32 nTimeout, UINT32 *nBytesRecived)
memberdef.name: HTTPClientReadData

briefdescription.para: Read data from the server. Parse out the chunks data.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to a buffer that will be filled with the servers response
The size of the buffer (numbers of bytes to read)
Count of the bytes that were received in this operation

briefdescription.para: Fill the users structure with the session information.
Initiate the headr searching functions and find the first header.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to a buffer that will be filled with the header name and value
